meanings.definition: To surpass in speaking or eloquence.
meanings.sent1: During the debate, Sarah managed to outspeak all her opponents.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to outspeak others in class discussions.
meanings.sent3: At the public speaking contest, he tried to outspeak the microphone!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for the topic allowed her to outspeak any doubts in the audience's minds.
meanings.sent5: His ability to outspeak his fears made him a confident speaker.

meanings.definition: To speak louder or more clearly than someone else.
meanings.sent1: In order to be heard over the crowd, she had to outspeak everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outspeak his friends when he gets excited about a topic.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to outspeak the noisy neighbors next door!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to be heard allowed her to outspeak the chaos of the city.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outspeaking the howling wind was a powerful sight.
